publicationstmt.publisher: Published by and available from the William Blake Archive, http://www.blakearchive.org

availability.p: ©2008 Morris Eaves, Robert N. Essick, Joseph Viscomi.

projectdesc.p: These collection lists were prepared for the William Blake Archive.

p.hi: None of the works in these collection lists is held at the offices of the William Blake Archive. Please contact the owning institution if you desire further information or wish to make arrangements to view any works.

div1.head: Illuminated Books
div1.bibl: There is No Natural Religion, copy G. Plates a3, a4, a6, a9, b3, b12.
Songs of Innocence. Plates 20 (recto with bottom design only), 21 (verso with bottom design only).
Songs of Innocence, copy Y. Plates 4, 5, 9, 10, 13, 14, 18.
The Marriage of Heaven and Hell. Plates 5 and 6 printed recto/verso.
The Marriage of Heaven and Hell, copy L (plates 25-27, "A Song of Liberty" only).
For Children: The Gates of Paradise. Plate 15, 2nd state.
America a Prophecy. Plate a. Modern impression from extant fragment of cancelled plate a.
Songs of Innocence and of Experience, posthumous copy h. Copy J(?), plate 28. Copy T, plate 32. Copy G, plate 40.
Europe a Prophecy, copy c. Plates 1, 4 (posthumous), 5 (posthumous), 11, 17 (1st proof state).
Europe a Prophecy. Plates 13 (recto) and 14 (verso), hand colored.
The First Book of Urizen. Plate 3, color printed proof.
The First Book of Urizen, copy G, rejected impression of Plate 4.
Small Book of Designs, copy B:The Marriage of Heaven and Hell, plate 20 (design only);The First Book of Urizen, plate 22.
Milton. Plate 38.
Jerusalem The Emanation of the Giant Albion. Plate 28, design only (posthumous).
The Ghost of Abel, copy E. Plate 1 only.
Laocoön, copy B.

div2.head: Designed and Engraved by Blake
div2.bibl: Chaucer, Geoffrey. The Prologue and Characters of Chaucer's Pilgrims. 1812. Plate 1 only.
Commins, Thomas. An Elegy Set to Music. 1786.
Hayley, William. Ballads. 1805. 2 copies.
Hayley, William. Designs to A Series of Ballads. 1802. All 4 ballads.
Hayley, William. Little Tom the Sailor(broadside).1800.
Remember Me! 1825.
Remember Me! 1825. Plate only.
Remember Me! 1826.
Virgil. The Pastorals of Virgil. 1821.
Virgil. The Pastorals of Virgil. 1821. Relief etchings of plates 6-9.

Virgil. The Pastorals of Virgil. 1821. Plates 5-17, 21-24 (Blake's wood engravings) only. Plate 7, Linnell impression and as printed in The Athenaeum on 21 Jan. 1843. Preliminary drawings for plates 7, 8, and 17.
Virgil. The Wood Engravings of William Blake. 1977.
Wollstonecraft, Mary. Original Stories from Real Life. 1791. 2 copies.
Wollstonecraft, Mary. Original Stories from Real Life. 1796.
Wollstonecraft, Mary. Original Stories from Real Life. 1796. Plates only.
Young, Edward. The Complaint, and the Consolation; or, Night Thoughts. 1797. Two copies, hand colored and uncolored.
Young, Edward. The Complaint, and the Consolation; or, Night Thoughts. 1797. Plate 11 only, 1st published state.

div2.head: Designed by Blake and Engraved by Other Engravers
div2.bibl: Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1808. folio.
Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1808. folio. Plates only.
Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1808. quarto. 2 copies.
Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1808. Pre-publication proofs of plates 3, 4 (two impressions in two different proof states), 7, 10. See also Deaths Door under Separate Plates, below.
Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1813. folio.
Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1813. quarto.
Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1813. quarto. Plates 8, 7, and 11 only. Printed on laid India.
Blair, Robert. The Grave. "1813" (i.e. 1870). folio.
Blair, Robert. The Grave. "1813" (i.e. 1870). Portfolio of plates only.
Blair, Robert. The Grave. New York, n.d. Plates re-engraved by A. L. Dick.
Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1847. Plates re-engraved by A. L. Dick.
Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1858. Plates re-engraved by A. L. Dick.
Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1926 portfolio.
Bürger, Gottfried. Leonora. 1796.
Bürger, Gottfried. Leonora. 1796. Plate 1 only. A proof with pencil corrections and a drawing by Blake on the verso.
Hayley, William. The Life and Posthumous Writings of William Cowper. New York. 1803.
Malkin, Benjamin Heath. A Father's Memoirs of His Child. 1806.
Malkin, Benjamin Heath. A Father's Memoirs of His Child. 1806. 2 proofs of the plate in 2 different states.
Mora, Jose Joaquin de. Meditaciones Poeticas. 1826.
Mora, Jose Joaquin de. Meditaciones Poeticas. 1826. Plates 3-5, 7-12 only.
Varley, John. A Treatise on Zodiacal Physiognomy. 1828.
Varley, John. A Treatise on Zodiacal Physiognomy. 1828. Plate 2 only.
Whitaker, John. The Seraph, A Collection of Sacred Music. 1818-28? Vol. 2 only.
Whitaker, John. The Seraph, A Collection of Sacred Music. 1818-28? Plate only.
Whitaker, John. The Seraph, A Collection of Sacred Music. 1825-28?
Wollstonecraft, Mary. Marie et Caroline. 1798-99.

Allen, Charles. A New and Improved History of England. 1798. Plate 2 only, with Fuseli's preliminary pen and ink drawing, incised by Blake.

Allen, Charles. A New and Improved Roman History. 1798. Plate 1 only, a proof.

Bible. The Royal Universal Family Bible. 1780. Plate 1 only. A later state not known to have been published.

The Cabinet of the Arts. 1799. Includes Blake's plate for Bellamy's Picturesque Magazine, 1793.

Flaxman, John. The Iliad of Homer. 1805. 2 copies.

Hayley, William. The Life of George Romney. 1809. An etched and engraved portrait of Romney intended for Hayley's biography but not published.

div1.head: Related Materials
div1.bibl: Blake, Robert (William Blake's brother). Study of Dancing Figures by A Tree (recto).A Deathbed Scene (verso).Pencil drawings.
Blake, William. Songs of Innocence and of Experience. Pickering edition, 1839, with annotations by William Michael Rossetti and Dante Gabriel Rossetti.
Cumberland, George. An album of 13 etchings by Cumberland, including 'To the Nightingale'
Etty, William. Letter to Thomas Campbell. March 25, 1830. With references to Blake.
Gilchrist, Alexander. Life of William Blake. 1863. James Smetham's copy with his marginal drawings.
Gilchrist, Alexander. Life of William Blake. 1880. William Michael Rossetti's copy with his annotations.
Linnell, John. Manuscript draft of an advertisement for Blake's Job engravings.
Linnell, John. Water color copy of Linnell's pencil portrait of Blake, probably executed by John Linnell, Jr.
Marsh, Edward Garrard. Letters to William Hayley. 1801-14. With references to Blake.
Richmond, George. Pen and ink portrait of Frederick Tatham, 1829
Robertson, W. Graham. Manuscript catalogue of his Blake collection2 vols.
Scott, William Bell. Portrait of Blake 4 impressions.
Shields, Frederic. Blake's Work-Room, Fountain Court. c. 1880. Wash drawing.
Stothard, Thomas. William Blake, Thomas Stothard and Mr. Ogleby in Custody by the Medway. Etching c. 1780-82.
